form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide an exception for certain public-private research arrangements from the business use test for purposes of determining private activity bonds.

section.header: Exception to business use test for certain public-private research arrangements

subsection.text: Section 141(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

subparagraph.text: Paragraph (1) shall not apply to an issue if the proceeds of such issue are to be used under an arrangement relating to basic research at a facility—

clause.text: owned by a governmental unit or a 501(c)(3) organization, and

the governmental unit or a 501(c)(3) organization enters into a bona fide, arm’s-length contractual arrangement with a person other than a governmental unit or a 501(c)(3) organization regarding the terms for sharing the economic benefits of any products resulting from basic research, including arrangements in which those economic terms (such as exclusive or non-exclusive licenses of intellectual property and licensing fees or royalty rates) are determined in advance at the time the parties enter into the contractual arrangement.

subparagraph.text: For purposes of subparagraph (A), the term basic research means any original investigation for the advancement of scientific knowledge not having a specific commercial objective.

subsection.text: The amendment made by subsection (a) shall apply to research agreements entered into after the date of the enactment of this Act.
